lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Your support of continued experimentation with costly bilingual programs (editorial, April 30) is a perfect example of the liberal route to a nonsolution of the language problems in California public education. As a former community college instructor in a school serving mostly Hispanic students, I found that California high school graduates lacked the language abilities needed to succeed even at a community college.
abstract: Letter from Patrick L Smithsays Apr 30 editorial is wrong to support continued experimentation with costly bilingual programs that do not work (S)

headline.main: Immigrant Children Thrive in English Immersion; Money Isn't the Solution
